author: A_Brickset_user
title: Good for a Castle collector.
review: This set is great. I was a little surprised when I recieved it, so I had no plans for using the peices, and I destroyed all my ROTJ mocs and setups (not too many) four days ago, so keeping it together for display made no sense. I opened the Castle Accessories at about the same time, then, on closer examination of Bib's armor, I noticed that it wasn't a robo/hightech/electro thingie, but a breastplate. Perfect for Castle. Now my king has good armor. Hurrah! And 3PO (different head, of course) looks like okay guard of something that isn't in existence. Overall, good for a castle collector.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Great Figs, thats all.
review: The only reason anybody should get this set is for the minifigs.Or if your making Jabbas palace. It might sound wierd but this is my first r2-d2 and c-3po. I think r2 is really cute. And he can fit in so many vechils, Tie bomber, Geosain Fighter all of those. Fortuna is a great new fig to have. The door it self is a nice desighn but thats really all. So this sets a 5. Not for the door but the figs

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Should be seen as a part of something greater
review:
This set is difficult to rate, because it depends on what you already have in terms of other sets.

All by itself, this Jabba's message does not do much. There's three minifigs and a portal. It supposedly depicts a scene in the film where the robots attempt to pass by the major domo of Jabba's palace. That's all.

But that doesn't mean this set can't be put to good use. If you've already got stuff from other sets, then the minifigs make great extras to spice up stories based on those. What's more, I've built the porch in different ways to depict different locales.

The conclusion must be that this is not a good starter set by itself, but makes a great expansion.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: answer to trevor's question: (how) does the door open & review: set is nice, the figs are sweeet
review:
trevor, the door opens vertically, this means that it is stopped by the eye camera getting in the way, but it rises high enough for some minifigs to enter, one at a time of course

as for the set itself: Bib Fortune is awesome!!! i love twi'leks (aayla secura is HOT) and the males have this wise wizard look (as in KOTOR) 3po & r2 have been included in too many sets if you ask me, but i didn't have any set with them included until i got this one. they are sweet but i can see a whole army of protocols and astromechs is kinda poitless unless you're planning on making a very big starship like a minifig sized star destroyer which needs many droids to keep running. (btw, is that huge star destroyer of the ultimate collectors series minifig scaled? too big? or too small?) as for the doorway its decent enough but i don't care for it as i bought it for Bib and the droids and the camera eye. the eye is nice, but the rest of the gate is kinda plain and nothing like its movie counterpart (where are those spikes at the bottom which gave it that massive and agressive look?) ah well, i won't be using this door much anyway. my only other complaint is that this set should have had a gamorrean added and give the jabba's prize set han carbonite + han fig + leia boushh and captured chewie, with new headsculpt with parted hair as chewie has in ROTJ) but i'm happy anyway
So to conclude: this is a very nice set if you're into collecting minifigs and mini vehicles (like i do) but not if you want many dioramas, though the option of connecting to jabba's palace is nice. very decent, recommended for the figs
the portal with the eye gets an 6, the figs a big 10, so that's why i give it an 8

May the Force be with you!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: niah
review:
The only reason I actualy purchased this set was because I wanted a 3Po figure, and the fortuna minifig looked also quite attractive.

The way the door opens is a good idea, it could be usefull, but R2 can't even get passed that door, he is too large! As far as I remember the movie, the entrance to jabba's place is quite big...whatever, as already said, if you are building jabba's palace or you want the minifigs, go and buy it. Otherwise, save your money for some bigger set!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Good set
review: nice set for a cheep price, one can never have enough R2 units and as far as i no, this is the only other set that has threepio for a really cheep price. I LOVE the Bib Fortuna, GREAT torso! The door could be improved, but what do you expect in such a small set!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: The great droid army
review:
This set is either great or a waste of time depending on what you're looking for. This is great if you don't have R2 or C-390 which I didn't. Them and Bib are really cool. If you want to make a great droid army that turns on their masters this is great, paint 390 and you can have ranks. Anyway the door is okay but if you want this set as something more than a minifig builder then you got the wrong set.

oh and in reply to Darth's question about the Star destroyer no. The star destroyer would need to be double or triple to be minifig size, I admit I don't have it but I've got the measurement of it.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: I don't think there going to let us in artoo
review:
This set is sweet and compared to the other attachment set there is more point getting this set because of the minifigs and the door.
I really like the amour Bib Fortuna weres and when I got it I needed a needed a new 3PO fig. 
Any way the eyeball thing on the door is a nice addition as well. The only problem is the size of the door. the door in the movie is about 10x the size of this door.

Get it if: You don't mind not getting Jabbas palace and adding Bib Fortuna and a door to your collection

Dont get it if: You hate bib fortuna and have 100's of C3PO's & R2-D2's or if you don't want it and you don't have Jabbas palace.
But I highly recommend this set as it is inexpensive and you get the cool figs.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Jabba's Message
review:
Jabba's Message is a nice small set that for it's size captures the likeness of the entrance to Jabba's Palace. If you want to stock up on droids and Twileks, tans pieces to create your own movie-accurate Jabba's Palace or simply want to complete the Palace line, this one is for you.

Pros:
* Bib Fortuna Minifigure
* R2-D2 and C-3PO in a small set
* The Droid "Eye"
* Plenty of tan pieces

Cons:
None

author: Pegasi
title: It Could Have Been a Lot Worse
review:
I don't really have a particular fondness for this set, mainly beacuse it doesn't really have anything to go for it, at least in my opinion. However, it does have two minifigures that, at least at its' time, were fairly rare.
  Of course, I don't really think that that is enough to say that it is that great a set, because the door looks as though it was thrown together, there aren't exactly a million uses for a Bib Fortuna minifig, a you could have just as easily got the two droids in the droid escape set. (7106)

author: Blade
title: An Outsiders Review
review:
I cant get over the amount of reviews this set has and how many are no longer members. Well as I have said before I don't know star wars, don't pretend to. The only reason why I am doing star wars reviews is: They are LEGO and some people may appreciate an "outsiders" view on the models.

The model itself seems quite simple. A nice big door that slides open, which is really cool. You could make a seriously wicked fortress using these. The colour of the bricks are nice too. The other thing i noticed is the peg on the left hand side which suggests it is part of a set and connects on to it.

The thing that really grabbed me about this set is the mini-figs. For its size it has three. Definitely upping the playability tenfold. The strange little robot in white with blue is cool, then there is a tan guy which I think is a robot as well. The last guy is in all blue, come with a cape and a strange helmet. These guys make excellent additions to any space set if you are not a star wars fan.

Overall it is a nice model with alot going for it. I'm sure if I understood star wars I could give alot more detail but even without I feel this is sufficient. I think this model deserves a 7/10 as star wars models seem to be well designed and lacking nothing really.

author: Caramel
title: only ever Bib Fortuna!
review: This set is great. You get R2-D2, C3PO and the only ever Bib Fortuna and the robotic eye. The door should be bigger since in the movie the door is huge.The door is a little woblley. over all great set.

author: Da_LegoBuilder
title: It's a 5 but strange...
review: I remember seeing this set, and even my cousin has this. This set is only good if you don't have r2, and c-3po. It also comes with Bib fortuna, a rare minifig, because i think you can only get this in this set. The 1 eyeball head looks like it in the movie, but there was like a bigger, vast gate.

author: Rgijaba
title: shame Bibs the only LEGO tw'lik ever made... yet...
review: tw'liks are my favorite spices, too... this one comes with Jabbas Mjor Domo, Bib Fortuna, C-3PO, and yet another R2-D2! but, if you dont have eather one of them, this sets for you (or you could get droid escape)! bibs minifig is well made, as usaull... the door also has a T-5 (i think its a T-5, its  some thing like that) camera, with a prited part for it, as well! the door is well-made, but VERY off-scale... in the movie, it was much, much, MUCH bigger! the set also should come with a Gamorian boar gaurd, but oh well... a must have for your LEGO Jabba's palace, and good for a collecter, but other wise, not a set to get...

author: Gus_263
title: Entering in the Jabba's Palace
review:
This star wars set was released in 2003, as a small set, including useful contents for any lego, with features for star wars. Altough small this have good contents, like the minifigure of Bib Fortuna (with good details and too a  little cover) and of the two droids, R2-D2 and C3PO. These have a lego style and playability of one(except R2-D2, with the playability of an astromech droid from lego). The C3PO's and Bib's head have a different shape to have accuracy with the movie scene on the begginning of the final movie. The set isn't an army builder, because have three minifigures, one different in comparison with other. But is cool to build scenes, like if combinated with the sets Jabba's palace and Jabba's prize. The door is well made, don't only in building, but in colors too, like the brown, glowing orange and the skincolor as the main color of it. Another cool thing is the "droid eye" on the door, good positioned to play with. This set isn't poor, but small, well if combined with the set jabba's palace. Being small, this deserves be compared with small sets, comparing contents, price, playability and accuracy with the movie, because this set is from star wars. 

Some contents are more common on this set in the skin color, like plates in the door and plates under the building of it. Too a piece above the door that makes part of the building keeps a good design to the set. The brown plates at the skin coloured ones keeps the door closed, but don't have why make this opened, if opened, the "droid eye" lost it's place. Too ramp pieces(brown ones are included) are useful due to be and was used previously, and later on more sets. The orange pieces make effects on the colors and also on the design. 

This is a small set, but isn't cheap like others small sets from different themes due to be star wars, and with the price are included the royalty of the names from star wars. If you understand that, is easy see why the star wars sets are more expensive if compared with other sets in number of contents. This is a good set and is recommended for any lego/star wars fan, is also an addition to other sets like jabba's palace for make scenes from the movie "Return of the Jedi".

author: AFOSL
title: New Minifig
review:
One word. Twi'lek!  This is another one of those must have Lego kits, purely because of the excellent Bib Fortuna mini figure.  It's also another cheap way to acquire 3P0 and R2, although I would imagine that serious collectors will have more than enough of these.
Like it's sister set, Jabba's Prize, this set has very little playability on it's own, but makes part of a whole when combined with that set and Jabba's Palace.
Being a small set, do not expect a high brick count or much variety in form or colour.  Afterall, it is trying to faithfully depict a certain scene.
Assembly is quick and easy, perfectly suited for younger collectors, but the finished construction is a little wobbly.  
Like I said before, if it wasn't for the inclusion of the new mini figure, exclusive to this set, it would not be worth buying, unless you are a someone who finds it necessary to complete the entire Star Wars line up.  And my guess is, if Bib Fortuna was included in the Jabba's Palace set, as some think he should have been, this little set probably would not have been produced.
4/5, but only because the Twi'lek is a must have for the avid collector.

author: AETerry
title: Jabba's Message Review
review:
I remember picking this up on Clearance from Target...

 

By itself, this set doesn't really feel it has much to offer then Bib Fortuna, C-3PO and R2D2.

 

If you have Jabba's Place, the large set to this little series within Star Wars, this set is a must have and indeed an add on. Out of nostalgia and a love for Star Wars, me I'm huge for Return of the Jedi, this was a lot of fun to build, even though its small.

author: woodall_aidan
title: Thank you comic book shop!
review: Today I was at my local comic book shop, and I saw a rack full of old Star Wars sets, and luckily, Jabba's Message was there, and so I got it. It is a terrific set, as it is the only set with Bib Fortuna. It also has a pearl light gold C-3PO and the original R2-D2. It is one of the better 2003 sets, and it deserves a good 5/5

review:
This was one of my first LEGO set, the first with C-3PO and R2-D2.
If I remember, it's the only set with the Jabba's trasleter, and its colours are very good.
I like that if you have the others sets of the palace of Jabba, you can build it.

author: Jacobisbased
title: Small, but good set
review: This set really stands out because it is currently the only set where can get the Bib Fortuna minifig! You also get R2-D2 and CP3O, the set is based around the beginning of Episode 6 where they go to Jabba's palace and have to get by the interrogation droid, the main part of the set is the wall with the interrogation droid and it is greatly detailed, in the movie the wall is gigantic but obviously Lego isn't going to make a huge set just for a wall, this set can also be attached to set 4480

author: VintageStarWars
title: Nice for a Tatooine Collection
review:
Box/Instructions

Box is pretty good. I like how, on the vintage boxes, the back has small pictures of the characters so you can compare. Instructions were fairly clear, though I did miss one piece.

Parts

The parts were good, especially for the time, and I really like how it works.

Minifigures

Good selection. I like how it includes Bib Fortuna, though I think that he would be more suited for Jabba's Palace.

The build

Pretty good. I like how it was not complex, yet still maintained the feel of the gate. It would be kind of cool, however, if they had added mybe a way to hide the eye droid when it wasn't supposed to be out.

The completed model

I like how the gate can move up and down, and that the droid pops out and then goes in. Good for recreation of the somewhat iconic scene.

Overall opinion

Very good. Though it could be a little bit bigger, I still think it works. The minifigure choice is superb, and is great for my Tatooine set collection.

author: BrickbyBrickDFM
title: Excited to own the Bib Fortuna Minifigure!
review: This set is a classic!  I sought it out mostly for the Bib Fortuna minifigure, however, I was impressed with the overall build experience. There were a total of 44 pieces, which included three minifigures. Bib Fortuna's design is excellent.  The prehensile tentacles mold sits atop of the head and it looks as if it is one piece. The C3PO minifigure is lacking in color. This gold color is really flat. I do like the R2D2 in comparison to the two droids.  As for the build, it is a simple doorway. However, even though it is a small build, the designer did not scamp on details. The robotic eye was a plus!  It really takes you back to that scene in the film when it popped out to see who was there.  I was not disappointed with this set.  Happy to own the Bib Fortuna minifigure.
